intro: Conyza lycopodioides, commonly known as the hairy conyza, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Conyza lycopodioides is adapted to dry conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
